title: Harris, Trump Barnstorm Key State Michigan, Where Polls Say They're Tied
content: Democrat Kamala Harris and Republican Donald Trump barreled through the battleground state of Michigan on Friday, where opinion polls show the U.S. presidential candidates are essentially tied just 18 days before the Nov. 5 election.
summary: Democrat Kamala Harris and Republican Donald Trump barreled through the battleground state of Michigan on Friday, where opinion polls show the U.S. presidential candidates are essentially tied just 18 days before the Nov. 5 election.

title: Israel And Iran-Backed Foes Hamas And Hezbollah Vow More War
content: Pledges from Israel and enemies Hamas and Hezbollah to keep fighting in Gaza and Lebanon dashed hopes on Friday that the death of Palestinian militant leader Yahya Sinwar might hasten an end to more than a year of escalating war in the Middle East.
summary: Pledges from Israel and enemies Hamas and Hezbollah to keep fighting in Gaza and Lebanon dashed hopes on Friday that the death of Palestinian militant leader Yahya Sinwar might hasten an end to more than a year of escalating war in the Middle East.

title: Meta Launches AI That Can Monitor Other AI As Human Involvement Diminishes
content: Facebook owner Meta said on Friday it was releasing a batch of new AI models from its research division, including a "Self-Taught Evaluator" that may offer a path toward less human involvement in the AI development process.
summary: Facebook owner Meta said on Friday it was releasing a batch of new AI models from its research division, including a "Self-Taught Evaluator" that may offer a path toward less human involvement in the AI development process.

title: Israel Says Intercepts Suspicious 'Aerial Target' Approaching From Syria
content: The Israeli military said it had intercepted a suspicious "aerial target" approaching from Syria on Friday, which a war monitor said was a drone launched by an Iran-backed group.
summary: The Israeli military said it had intercepted a suspicious "aerial target" approaching from Syria on Friday, which a war monitor said was a drone launched by an Iran-backed group.

title: Cuba Plunges Into Countrywide Darkness As National Power Grid Fails
content: Cuba plunged into a countrywide blackout on Friday after one of the island's major power plants failed and caused the national electrical grid to shut down, its energy ministry said.
summary: Cuba plunged into a countrywide blackout on Friday after one of the island's major power plants failed and caused the national electrical grid to shut down, its energy ministry said.

title: 3 Decades Later, First Brown Dwarf Ever Found Offers A Surprise
content: In 1995, astronomers confirmed the discovery for the first time of a brown dwarf, a body too small to be a star and too big to be a planet - sort of a celestial tweener. But it turns out that was not the full story.
summary: In 1995, astronomers confirmed the discovery for the first time of a brown dwarf, a body too small to be a star and too big to be a planet - sort of a celestial tweener. But it turns out that was not the full story.

title: "We Have A Lot Of Interest In Indian Films": Putin Praises Bollywood
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday praised 'Bollywood' and said that Indian films are most popular in the country in a media briefing ahead of the BRICS Summit.
summary: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday praised 'Bollywood' and said that Indian films are most popular in the country in a media briefing ahead of the BRICS Summit.

title: Kamala Harris's Witty Reply Stumps Hecklers Backing Trump, Crowd Applauds
content: Democrat nominee Kamala Harris silenced disruptors at her rally in Wisconsin on Thursday by asking Trump supporters to "go to the smaller one down the street", and the video has gone viral.
summary: Democrat nominee Kamala Harris silenced disruptors at her rally in Wisconsin on Thursday by asking Trump supporters to "go to the smaller one down the street", and the video has gone viral.

title: Meta Releases AI Model That Can Check How Other Models Work
content: Facebook owner Meta said on Friday it was releasing a batch of new AI models from its research division, including a "Self-Taught Evaluator" that may offer a path toward less human involvement in the AI development process.
summary: Facebook owner Meta said on Friday it was releasing a batch of new AI models from its research division, including a "Self-Taught Evaluator" that may offer a path toward less human involvement in the AI development process.

title: Hamas Searching For Yahya Sinwar's Replacement Outside Gaza: Report
content: The Palestinian militant group Hamas will likely replace Yahya Sinwar with a new political leader based outside Gaza while his brother - Mohammad Sinwar - is expected to assume a bigger role directing the war against Israel in the territory.
summary: The Palestinian militant group Hamas will likely replace Yahya Sinwar with a new political leader based outside Gaza while his brother - Mohammad Sinwar - is expected to assume a bigger role directing the war against Israel in the territory.

title: Obamas And Kamala Harris Team Up In Historic Campaign Appearance
content: With just three weeks remaining in the presidential campaign, the polls still find it to be an even-steven affair. Harris hopes to tap into some political charisma from the Obamas, especially with her losing ground to Trump as polls suggest.
summary: With just three weeks remaining in the presidential campaign, the polls still find it to be an even-steven affair. Harris hopes to tap into some political charisma from the Obamas, especially with her losing ground to Trump as polls suggest.

title: Singapore Teen Arrested For Allegedly Planning ISIS-Inspired Terror Attack
content: Singapore has arrested a teenage boy who was allegedly planning an ISIS-inspired terror attack on a busy suburb, the interior minister said Friday, adding it was a "very close shave".
summary: Singapore has arrested a teenage boy who was allegedly planning an ISIS-inspired terror attack on a busy suburb, the interior minister said Friday, adding it was a "very close shave".

title: Damaged Ship Carrying Explosive Cargo Stranded In North Sea For Weeks
content: A damaged ship, spurned by European ports because of its potentially explosive cargo, has been stranded in the North Sea for weeks while authorities work out what to do with it.
summary: A damaged ship, spurned by European ports because of its potentially explosive cargo, has been stranded in the North Sea for weeks while authorities work out what to do with it.

title: Can Hamas Recover After Yahya Sinwar's Killing? What Experts Say
content: Israel's killing of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar dealt a huge blow to the Palestinian group, and while it leaves a gaping void at the top of the movement, its militants remain determined to fight.
summary: Israel's killing of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar dealt a huge blow to the Palestinian group, and while it leaves a gaping void at the top of the movement, its militants remain determined to fight.

title: Australia's Northern Territory To Soon Resume Jailing 10-Year-Olds
content: The Australian Northern Territory (NT) will soon allow children as young as 10 to be jailed again, after a reversal of the previous government's decision to raise the age of criminal responsibility to 12.
summary: The Australian Northern Territory (NT) will soon allow children as young as 10 to be jailed again, after a reversal of the previous government's decision to raise the age of criminal responsibility to 12.

title: India Dispatches 11 Tons Of Medical Aid To Lebanon
content: India on Friday dispatched the first tranche of 11 tons of medical supplies to Lebanon as part of a humanitarian effort to support the nation amid rising tensions and the ongoing conflict in southern Lebanon.
summary: India on Friday dispatched the first tranche of 11 tons of medical supplies to Lebanon as part of a humanitarian effort to support the nation amid rising tensions and the ongoing conflict in southern Lebanon.

title: Company Hacked After Accidentally Hiring North Korean Cyber Criminal
content: A company recently found itself in a difficult situation after it accidentally hired a North Korean IT worker, who later stole sensitive data and attempted to extort the company after being fired.
summary: A company recently found itself in a difficult situation after it accidentally hired a North Korean IT worker, who later stole sensitive data and attempted to extort the company after being fired.

title: Kyiv Says Bodies Of 501 Ukrainian Soldiers Killed Fighting Russia Returned
content: Kyiv said Friday it had received the bodies of 501 servicemen killed fighting Russian forces, mainly in eastern Ukraine.
summary: Kyiv said Friday it had received the bodies of 501 servicemen killed fighting Russian forces, mainly in eastern Ukraine.

title: Senior ISIS Terrorist, 3 Others Killed In Iraqi Strike: US Military
content: Iraqi air strikes killed a senior ISIS terrorist and three other operatives, the US military announced Friday, saying the strikes were enabled by intelligence from the international anti-jihadist coalition.
summary: Iraqi air strikes killed a senior ISIS terrorist and three other operatives, the US military announced Friday, saying the strikes were enabled by intelligence from the international anti-jihadist coalition.

title: Hamas Confirms Yahya Sinwar Killed By Israel, Won't Free Hostages Until...
content: Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar, architect of the group's cross-border raids in 2023 that became the deadliest day in Israel's history, was killed in combat, Khalil Al-Hayya, deputy Gaza Hamas chief and the group's chief negotiator, said on Friday.
summary: Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar, architect of the group's cross-border raids in 2023 that became the deadliest day in Israel's history, was killed in combat, Khalil Al-Hayya, deputy Gaza Hamas chief and the group's chief negotiator, said on Friday.
